comments:
I am currently running Eclipse 3.0 on SuSE 9.1 (using the linux-gtk
build and ibm.zip as the webtools project).  When I try to access the
example PurchaseOrder.xsd file in the XMLExamples project (as per the
getting started guide), I receive an error dialog box stating, "An error
has occurred.  See error log for more details."

This sounds like the wrong version of GEF is installed. Mind retrying with 3.0 
version of GEF? (Or, confirm is that's what you have).

Is this the 3.0 version I should have? (I downloaded the linked GEF-ALL-3.0.zip
from the main ibm webtools download page)

I went into the (what seemed to me to be) main GEF plugin directory and did the
following:

rocky@cronos:/usr/misc/apps/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.gef_3.0.0> cat
plugin.xml  | grep version
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<?eclipse version="3.0"?>
   version="3.0.0"
      <import plugin="org.eclipse.draw2d" export="true" version="3.0.0"/>

If there's a better way of confirming the version info, let me know.

I'm not sure what was wrong with that ibm.zip version, but suspect it was just 
a bug due to its "snapshot" nature of development stream (that is, had not much
testing). 

I've tried xsd files on latest I-builds, and seems to work fine. 

If you see problems with I-build version, please re-open. And .. you might
attach a sample file you use when you see the problem, since maybe its very
specific to some particular node or relationship. 

Thanks.
Assuming all is well. Please open bugs on new stuff as you find things.
